intro: Maclura cochinchinensis var. bancroftii, commonly known as the Chinese horse chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to southern China. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces large, spiny fruits that contain a single, hard-shelled seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species in both horticulture and ecological contexts.
